intro: Pyrrocoma pinea, commonly known as the Canary Island pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to the Canary Islands. It has a distinctive appearance with long, needle-like leaves and a tall, slender trunk. The tree produces cones that are typically reddish-brown in color and contain edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been introduced to other parts of the world for landscaping purposes.
